CVE-2024-53983
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T21:36:22

4 posts

### Impact A vulnerability is identified in Backstage Scaffolder template functionality where Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) can be exploited to perform Git config injection. The vulnerability allows an attacker to capture privileged git tokens used by the Backstage Scaffolder plugin. With these tokens, unauthorized access to sensitive resources in git can be achieved. The impact is consid

CVE-2024-53848
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T17:29:06

4 posts

### Impact The default cache strategy uses the basename of a remote schema as the name of the file in the cache, e.g. `https://example.org/schema.json` will be stored as `schema.json`. This naming allows for conflicts. If an attacker can get a user to run `check-jsonschema` against a malicious schema URL, e.g., `https://example.evil.org/schema.json`, they can insert their own schema into the cach

CVE-2023-28461
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2024-12-02T17:15:05.133000

10 posts

Array Networks Array AG Series and vxAG (9.4.0.481 and earlier) allow remote code execution. An attacker can browse the filesystem on the SSL VPN gateway using a flags attribute in an HTTP header without authentication. The product could then be exploited through a vulnerable URL. The 2023-03-09 vendor advisory stated "a new Array AG release with the fix will be available soon."

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T14:59:43.156Z ##

Just a note that CVE-2023-28461 (9.8 critical) Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability, added 25 November 2024 to the KEV Catalog, is known to be used in ransomware campaigns, according to CISA.

EDIT: NEW! Fancy red triangle 🔺when known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

EDIT2: Known to be exploited by the Chinese state actor "Earth Kasha" which may be related to APT10. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/k/lodeinfo-campaign-of-earth-kasha.html

#CVE_2023_28461 #arraynetworks #ransomware #threatintel #vulnerability #infosec #cve #eitw #activeexploitation #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #kev #cisa

(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T15:32:42

4 posts

A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in code-projects Concert Ticket Ordering System 1.0. Affected is an unknown function of the file /tour(cor).php. The manipulation of the argument mai leads to sql injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

Tenable has also listed these vulnerabilities:

- CVE-2024-12015 (high): SQL Injection in #WordPress Project Manager Plugin https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-2024-47

- CVE-2024-44102: (critical): Siemens TeleControl Server Basic Deserialization Vulnerability https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-2024-46

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:56:06.000Z ##

Tenable: If You Only Have 1 Minute: Quick Tips for Effective Exposure Response https://www.tenable.com/blog/if-you-only-have-1-minute-quick-tips-for-effective-exposure-response @tenable #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2024-11995
(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-29T21:31:04

4 posts

A vulnerability has been found in code-projects Farmacia 1.0 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /pagamento.php. The manipulation of the argument total leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

##

CVE-2024-9474
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.51%

updated 2024-11-29T18:35:05

29 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows a PAN-OS administrator with access to the management web interface to perform actions on the firewall with root privileges. Cloud NGFW and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability.

Nuclei template

https://github.com/XiaomingX/cve-2024-0012-poc

https://github.com/k4nfr3/CVE-2024-9474

https://github.com/deathvu/CVE-2024-9474

👉 Detect them with our Network Scanner
👉 Get proof for validation with Sniper: Auto-Exploiter
👉 Save tons of manual effort with our precise targeting for pre-auth RCEs

Time to act - log in now and get to work👇

🔗 Find out more in our Vulnerabilities & Exploits Databese: https://pentest-tools.com/vulnerabilities-exploits/palo-alto-networks-expedition-remote-code-execution_23840

🔗 WatchTowr Labs Deep Dive on the subject: https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/

##
h4sh at 2024-11-25T01:41:05.463Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @screaminggoat @todb That's pretty much what happened with the recent Palo Alto unauthenticated RCE activity. They first published their own security advisory (PAN-SA-2024-0015) that's not a CVE, told customers to remove internet access to the management interface, and then figured out details for CVEs and published it in the next few days. It turned out be two different vulns (CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474)

The turnaround between active exploitation (exploit sold on forums, around Oct 31) and the CVEs assigned (19 Nov) was roughly 20 days. I believe that was an honest effort on behalf of palo (they didn't try to cover it), but it was still a bit too long

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-24T15:27:52.441Z ##

@nopatience

TAG-110, a Russia-aligned group, conducted extensive cyber-espionage campaigns across Asia and Europe using HATVIBE and CHERRYSPY malware

Virus Bulletin wrote "TAG-110 overlaps with UAC-0063, which CERT-UA attributes with moderate confidence to the Russian espionage group BlueDelta (APT28)."

For your Critical Infrastructure section, dunno if you covered this in the previous week, but the Environmental Protection Agency's Office of the Inspector General had a report on 13 November about a "passive assessment of cybersecurity vulnerabilities conducted on drinking water systems with populations served of 50,000 people or greater." https://www.epaoig.gov/reports/other/management-implication-report-cybersecurity-concerns-related-drinking-water-systems

Palo Alto Networks was actually a 2 week long saga of from unconfirmed RCE rumors to zero-day exploitation of a two-bug chain:

  • "Palo Alto Networks is aware of a claim of a remote code execution vulnerability via the PAN-OS management interface." https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/PAN-SA-2024-0015 on 08 November leading to
  • "Palo Alto Networks has observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet." on 14 November
  • indicators of compromise on 15 November
  • https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-0012 and https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 on 18 November 2024 with Unit 42 advisory with IOC https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-0012-cve-2024-9474/ and U.S. CISA adding them to the KEV catalog https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/11/07/cisa-adds-four-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog
  • vulnerability analysis and nuclei template from watchTowr on 19 November https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/
  • further updates from Unit 42 on 21 November and new IOC from Arctic Wolf on 22 November https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog-uk/threat-campaign-targeting-palo-alto-networks-firewall-devices/
##
tecteschi@mastodon.social at 2024-11-23T05:51:29.000Z ##

https://go.twuai.com/ping/7440348322243389786 Recientemente, se ha reportado que más de 2,000 firewalls de Palo Alto Networks han sido comprometidos debido a la explotación de vulnerabilidades de zero-day en su sistema operativo PAN-OS. Estas brechas de seguridad, identificadas como CVE-2024-0012 y CVE-2024-9474, han permitido a actores maliciosos obtener acceso no autorizado y realizar acciones administrativas en dispositivos críticos.

Detalles Relevantes:

1. Descripción de las V

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-23T02:01:31.383Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Threat Campaign Targeting Palo Alto Networks Firewall Devices
Arctic Wolf reports on recent CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474 exploitation of Palo Alto Network firewall devices. They provide exploitation details that spans retrieving Sliver C2 payloads, exfiltrating credentials, deploying PHP webshells, and XMrig cryptominers. Indicators of Compromise provided

#threatintel #ioc #paloaltonetworks #panos #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #CVE_2024_0012 #cve_2024_9474

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-11-21T21:31:26.000Z ##

Over 2,000 Palo Alto Firewalls Hacked Using Recently Patched Vulnerabilities (PATCH NOW)

The cybersecurity landscape is heating up as hackers exploit two recently patched vulnerabilities in Palo Alto Networks firewalls, resulting in over 2,000 compromised devices worldwide.

- CVE-2024-0012 – Authentication bypass in the PAN-OS management web interface, allowing attackers to gain admin privileges.
- CVE-2024-9474 – Privilege escalation enabling attackers to run commands with root access.

##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-21T02:01:36.166Z ##

Unit 42 11/20 update: ⁠Threat Brief: Operation Lunar Peek, Activity Related to CVE-2024-0012

20 November 2024 update regarding Operation Lunar Peek and the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474: Unit 42 updated the Executive Summary, the Current Scope of the Attack section, but most importantly, there are new Indicators of Compromise (IoC).

@dreadpir8robots @screaminggoat @todb That's pretty much what happened with the recent Palo Alto unauthenticated RCE activity. They first published their own security advisory (PAN-SA-2024-0015) that's not a CVE, told customers to remove internet access to the management interface, and then figured out details for CVEs and published it in the next few days. It turned out be two different vulns (CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474)

The turnaround between active exploitation (exploit sold on forums, around Oct 31) and the CVEs assigned (19 Nov) was roughly 20 days. I believe that was an honest effort on behalf of palo (they didn't try to cover it), but it was still a bit too long

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-24T15:27:52.000Z ##

@nopatience

TAG-110, a Russia-aligned group, conducted extensive cyber-espionage campaigns across Asia and Europe using HATVIBE and CHERRYSPY malware

Virus Bulletin wrote "TAG-110 overlaps with UAC-0063, which CERT-UA attributes with moderate confidence to the Russian espionage group BlueDelta (APT28)."

For your Critical Infrastructure section, dunno if you covered this in the previous week, but the Environmental Protection Agency's Office of the Inspector General had a report on 13 November about a "passive assessment of cybersecurity vulnerabilities conducted on drinking water systems with populations served of 50,000 people or greater." https://www.epaoig.gov/reports/other/management-implication-report-cybersecurity-concerns-related-drinking-water-systems

Palo Alto Networks was actually a 2 week long saga of from unconfirmed RCE rumors to zero-day exploitation of a two-bug chain:

  • "Palo Alto Networks is aware of a claim of a remote code execution vulnerability via the PAN-OS management interface." https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/PAN-SA-2024-0015 on 08 November leading to
  • "Palo Alto Networks has observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet." on 14 November
  • indicators of compromise on 15 November
  • https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-0012 and https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 on 18 November 2024 with Unit 42 advisory with IOC https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-0012-cve-2024-9474/ and U.S. CISA adding them to the KEV catalog https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/11/07/cisa-adds-four-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog
  • vulnerability analysis and nuclei template from watchTowr on 19 November https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/
  • further updates from Unit 42 on 21 November and new IOC from Arctic Wolf on 22 November https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog-uk/threat-campaign-targeting-palo-alto-networks-firewall-devices/

##
mttaggart@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T16:13:30.000Z ##

Reading the awesome WatchTowr writeup of CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474, the Palo Alto RCE/privesc one-two punch. Great work here as always. And h/t to @screaminggoat , of course.

https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/

A few things stand out:

First, sorry @cR0w, no #directorytraversalmemes for you:

We simply… supply the off value to the X-PAN-AUTHCHECK HTTP request header, and the server helpfully turns off authentication?! At this point, why is anyone surprised?

That’s right folks, a simple reproducer for CVE-2024-0012. It couldn't be easier than that.

That's the auth bypass. And then, WHAT IS THIS DOING IN ANYTHING

return $p->pexecute("/usr/local/bin/pan_elog -u audit -m $msg -o $username");

So obviously if that $username has shell metacharacters, you have yourself a nice command injection.

And guess what user the service runs as?

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T15:48:04.000Z ##

watchTowr: Pots and Pans, AKA an SSLVPN - Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474
With the release of security patches for Palo Alto Networks' exploited zero-days, watchTowr performed some patch-diffing and found the root cause of CVE-2024-0012: "We simply… supply the off value to the X-PAN-AUTHCHECK HTTP request header, and the server helpfully turns off authentication?!" and of CVE-2024-9474: "Somehow a user is able to pass a username containing shell metacharacters into the AuditLog.write() function, which then passes its value to pexecute()." The remote command execution vulnerability of CVE-2024-9474 is the ability to pass a curl command for the user value in the POST request; which allows the attacker to specify an arbitrary user, an arbitrary user role (&userRole=superuser) and be granted a valid PHP session.

#CVE_2024_0012 #CVE_2024_9474 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #paloaltonetworks #panos #rootcauseanalysis #infosec #cybersecurity

##
ljrk@todon.eu at 2024-11-19T11:30:19.000Z ##

@christopherkunz Palo Alto keeps on giving.

https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/amp/

##
_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T09:43:06.000Z ##

: CISA adds CVE-2024-1212, CVE-2024-0012, and CVE-2024-9474 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog (KEV).

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/so5jib

  • CVE-2024-49805 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49806 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49804 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability

Leave it to a network security policy management solution to have hardcoded credentials. h/t: @xtrc

##

CVE-2024-0012
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.19%

updated 2024-11-29T18:34:02

33 posts

An authentication bypass in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to gain PAN-OS administrator privileges to perform administrative actions, tamper with the configuration, or exploit other authenticated privilege escalation vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-9474 https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 .

Nuclei template

https://github.com/iSee857/CVE-2024-0012-poc

🔗 WatchTowr Labs Deep Dive on the subject: https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/

##
h4sh at 2024-11-25T01:41:05.463Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @screaminggoat @todb That's pretty much what happened with the recent Palo Alto unauthenticated RCE activity. They first published their own security advisory (PAN-SA-2024-0015) that's not a CVE, told customers to remove internet access to the management interface, and then figured out details for CVEs and published it in the next few days. It turned out be two different vulns (CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474)

The turnaround between active exploitation (exploit sold on forums, around Oct 31) and the CVEs assigned (19 Nov) was roughly 20 days. I believe that was an honest effort on behalf of palo (they didn't try to cover it), but it was still a bit too long

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-24T15:27:52.441Z ##

@nopatience

TAG-110, a Russia-aligned group, conducted extensive cyber-espionage campaigns across Asia and Europe using HATVIBE and CHERRYSPY malware

Virus Bulletin wrote "TAG-110 overlaps with UAC-0063, which CERT-UA attributes with moderate confidence to the Russian espionage group BlueDelta (APT28)."

For your Critical Infrastructure section, dunno if you covered this in the previous week, but the Environmental Protection Agency's Office of the Inspector General had a report on 13 November about a "passive assessment of cybersecurity vulnerabilities conducted on drinking water systems with populations served of 50,000 people or greater." https://www.epaoig.gov/reports/other/management-implication-report-cybersecurity-concerns-related-drinking-water-systems

Palo Alto Networks was actually a 2 week long saga of from unconfirmed RCE rumors to zero-day exploitation of a two-bug chain:

  • "Palo Alto Networks is aware of a claim of a remote code execution vulnerability via the PAN-OS management interface." https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/PAN-SA-2024-0015 on 08 November leading to
  • "Palo Alto Networks has observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet." on 14 November
  • indicators of compromise on 15 November
  • https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-0012 and https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 on 18 November 2024 with Unit 42 advisory with IOC https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-0012-cve-2024-9474/ and U.S. CISA adding them to the KEV catalog https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/11/07/cisa-adds-four-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog
  • vulnerability analysis and nuclei template from watchTowr on 19 November https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/
  • further updates from Unit 42 on 21 November and new IOC from Arctic Wolf on 22 November https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog-uk/threat-campaign-targeting-palo-alto-networks-firewall-devices/

Estas brechas de seguridad, identificadas como CVE-2024-0012 y CVE-2024-9474, han permitido a actores maliciosos obtener acceso no autorizado y realizar acciones administrativas en dispositivos críticos.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-23T02:01:31.383Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Threat Campaign Targeting Palo Alto Networks Firewall Devices
Arctic Wolf reports on recent CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474 exploitation of Palo Alto Network firewall devices. They provide exploitation details that spans retrieving Sliver C2 payloads, exfiltrating credentials, deploying PHP webshells, and XMrig cryptominers. Indicators of Compromise provided

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-11-21T21:31:26.000Z ##

Over 2,000 Palo Alto Firewalls Hacked Using Recently Patched Vulnerabilities (PATCH NOW)

The cybersecurity landscape is heating up as hackers exploit two recently patched vulnerabilities in Palo Alto Networks firewalls, resulting in over 2,000 compromised devices worldwide.

- CVE-2024-0012 – Authentication bypass in the PAN-OS management web interface, allowing attackers to gain admin privileges.
- CVE-2024-9474 – Privilege escalation enabling attackers to run commands with root access.

20 November 2024 update regarding Operation Lunar Peek and the zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474: Unit 42 updated the Executive Summary, the Current Scope of the Attack section, but most importantly, there are new Indicators of Compromise (IoC).

1) CVE-2024-0012 has been assigned
2) Indicators of Compromise has been updated.
3) Added a section "What if I found one of the IOCs in my Organization's environment??"
4) Affected Products and Product versions has been updated
5) Fixed versions has been updated.

##
mttaggart@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T16:13:30.000Z ##

Reading the awesome WatchTowr writeup of CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474, the Palo Alto RCE/privesc one-two punch. Great work here as always. And h/t to @screaminggoat , of course.

https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/

A few things stand out:

First, sorry @cR0w, no #directorytraversalmemes for you:

We simply… supply the off value to the X-PAN-AUTHCHECK HTTP request header, and the server helpfully turns off authentication?! At this point, why is anyone surprised?

That’s right folks, a simple reproducer for CVE-2024-0012. It couldn't be easier than that.

That's the auth bypass. And then, WHAT IS THIS DOING IN ANYTHING

return $p->pexecute("/usr/local/bin/pan_elog -u audit -m $msg -o $username");

So obviously if that $username has shell metacharacters, you have yourself a nice command injection.

And guess what user the service runs as?

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T15:48:04.000Z ##

watchTowr: Pots and Pans, AKA an SSLVPN - Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474
With the release of security patches for Palo Alto Networks' exploited zero-days, watchTowr performed some patch-diffing and found the root cause of CVE-2024-0012: "We simply… supply the off value to the X-PAN-AUTHCHECK HTTP request header, and the server helpfully turns off authentication?!" and of CVE-2024-9474: "Somehow a user is able to pass a username containing shell metacharacters into the AuditLog.write() function, which then passes its value to pexecute()." The remote command execution vulnerability of CVE-2024-9474 is the ability to pass a curl command for the user value in the POST request; which allows the attacker to specify an arbitrary user, an arbitrary user role (&userRole=superuser) and be granted a valid PHP session.

#CVE_2024_0012 #CVE_2024_9474 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #paloaltonetworks #panos #rootcauseanalysis #infosec #cybersecurity

CISA Adds Three Critical Vulnerabilities to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

: CISA adds CVE-2024-1212, CVE-2024-0012, and CVE-2024-9474 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog (KEV).

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/so5jib

##

CVE-2024-44309
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-11-29T18:28:16.227000

16 posts

A cookie management issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 18.1.1, iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2, macOS Sequoia 15.1.1, iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1, visionOS 2.1.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is not protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

> "Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, DO NOT run the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

However the WebKitGTK does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

So online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##
dominee at 2024-11-22T08:45:43.221Z ##

#Apple fixes two zero-days used in attacks on Intel-based Macs < https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/apple-fixes-two-zero-days-used-in-attacks-on-intel-based-macs/ < JavaScriptCore (CVE-2024-44308) and WebKit (CVE-2024-44309) < 🔥

skry@mastodon.social at 2024-11-22T06:25:44.000Z ##

TLDR: Update Macs and iOS devices, throw D-Link VPN routers away. Safari and browsers are vulnerable, D-Link mfgr; wontfix

“Apple released patches for a pair of exploited zero-day bugs affecting older Intel Macs this week. Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) found that maliciously crafted web pages could in one case (CVE-2024-44308) lead to arbitrary code execution and a cross-site scripting attack in another (CVE-2024-44309). (1/3)

Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-44308 Apple Multiple Products Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-44309 Apple Multiple Products Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21287 (7.5 high) Oracle Agile Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Incorrect Authorization Vulnerability

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-11-21T16:01:06.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-44309
Vendor: Apple
Product: Multiple Products
Date Added: 2024-11-21
Vulnerability: Apple Multiple Products Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
Notes: https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752, https://support.apple.com/en-us/121753, https://support.apple.com/en-us/121754, https://support.apple.com/en-us/121755, https://support.apple.com/en-us/121756 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-44309
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-44309

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is not protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

> "Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, DO NOT run the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

However the WebKitGTK does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

So online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##
skry@mastodon.social at 2024-11-22T06:25:44.000Z ##

TLDR: Update Macs and iOS devices, throw D-Link VPN routers away. Safari and browsers are vulnerable, D-Link mfgr; wontfix

“Apple released patches for a pair of exploited zero-day bugs affecting older Intel Macs this week. Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) found that maliciously crafted web pages could in one case (CVE-2024-44308) lead to arbitrary code execution and a cross-site scripting attack in another (CVE-2024-44309). (1/3)

📣 EMERGENCY UPDATES 📣

Apple pushed additional updates for 2 zero-days that may have been actively exploited.

🐛 CVE-2024-44308 (JavaScriptCore) additional patches,
🐛 CVE-2024-44309 (WebKit) additional patches:
- visionOS 2.1.1

#apple #cybersecurity #infosec #security #ios

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T18:58:41.000Z ##

Apple exploited zero-days

  • About the security content of macOS Sequoia 15.1.1
  • About the security content of iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1
  • About the security content of iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2
  • About the security content of visionOS 2.1.1

  • About the security content of Safari 18.1.1

  • CVE-2024-44308 JavaScriptCore Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

  • CVE-2024-44309 WebKit Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

Both zero-days reported by Clément Lecigne and Benoît Sevens of Google's Threat Analysis Group h/t: @applsec cc: @campuscodi @mttaggart @cR0w @briankrebs @ntkramer @iagox86 @dreadpir8robots @catc0n

#apple #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cve #CVE_2024_44308 #CVE_2024_44309

CVE-2024-11968
(6.3 MEDIUM)

CVE-2024-11667
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-28T03:15:14.943000

28 posts

A directory traversal vulnerability in the web management interface of Zyxel ATP series firmware versions V5.00 through V5.38, USG FLEX series firmware versions V5.00 through V5.38, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions V5.10 through V5.38, and USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions V5.10 through V5.38 could allow an attacker to download or upload files via a crafted URL.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T19:46:34.759Z ##

CCCS (Canada) security advisory: Zyxel security advisory (AV24-689)
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security just outright said "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited."

While Zyxel's security advisory hasn't updated since 27 November 2024, and the language is ambiguous... This is an official government security advisory and CCCS could be referring to direct communication with the vendor. Patch your shit to address CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) Zyxel firewall directory traversal vulnerability. Threat actors are actively exploiting Zyxel firewalls to deploy Helldown ransomware.

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

#CVE_2024_11667 #directoryTraversalMemes

i0null at 2024-11-29T00:36:04.589Z ##

#directoryTraversalMemes

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.637Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.000Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-11-28T05:25:25.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-11667 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-11667/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_11667

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-29T10:25:02.000Z ##

updated 2024-11-27T21:57:08

2 posts

The Kubernetes kubelet component allows arbitrary command execution via specially crafted gitRepo volumes.This issue affects kubelet: through 1.28.11, from 1.29.0 through 1.29.6, from 1.30.0 through 1.30.2.

CVE-2024-54004
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T20:12:14

2 posts

Jenkins Filesystem List Parameter Plugin 0.0.14 and earlier does not restrict the path used for the File system objects list Parameter. This allows attackers with Item/Configure permission to enumerate file names on the Jenkins controller file system. Filesystem List Parameter Plugin 0.0.15 ensures that paths used by the File system objects list Parameter are restricted to an allow list, with th

screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T18:41:55.401Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-11-27

  • CVE-2024-47855 (7.5 high) Denial of service vulnerability in bundled json-lib
  • CVE-2024-54003 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Simple Queue Plugin
  • CVE-2024-54004 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Filesystem List Parameter Plugin cc: @cR0w

No mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-54003
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T19:49:05

2 posts

Jenkins Simple Queue Plugin 1.4.4 and earlier does not escape the view name. This results in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers with View/Create permission. Simple Queue Plugin 1.4.5 escapes the view name.

##

CVE-2024-44308
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-11-27T19:35:10.147000

16 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in Safari 18.1.1, iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2, macOS Sequoia 15.1.1, iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1, visionOS 2.1.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is not protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

> "Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, DO NOT run the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

However the WebKitGTK does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

So online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##
dominee at 2024-11-22T08:45:43.221Z ##

#Apple fixes two zero-days used in attacks on Intel-based Macs < https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/apple-fixes-two-zero-days-used-in-attacks-on-intel-based-macs/ < JavaScriptCore (CVE-2024-44308) and WebKit (CVE-2024-44309) < 🔥

##
skry@mastodon.social at 2024-11-22T06:25:44.000Z ##

TLDR: Update Macs and iOS devices, throw D-Link VPN routers away. Safari and browsers are vulnerable, D-Link mfgr; wontfix

“Apple released patches for a pair of exploited zero-day bugs affecting older Intel Macs this week. Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) found that maliciously crafted web pages could in one case (CVE-2024-44308) lead to arbitrary code execution and a cross-site scripting attack in another (CVE-2024-44309). (1/3)

  • CVE-2024-44309 Apple Multiple Products Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-21287 (7.5 high) Oracle Agile Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Incorrect Authorization Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T18:58:41.000Z ##

Apple exploited zero-days

  • About the security content of macOS Sequoia 15.1.1
  • About the security content of iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1
  • About the security content of iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2
  • About the security content of visionOS 2.1.1

  • About the security content of Safari 18.1.1

  • CVE-2024-44308 JavaScriptCore Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

  • CVE-2024-44309 WebKit Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

Both zero-days reported by Clément Lecigne and Benoît Sevens of Google's Threat Analysis Group h/t: @applsec cc: @campuscodi @mttaggart @cR0w @briankrebs @ntkramer @iagox86 @dreadpir8robots @catc0n

- iOS and iPadOS 17.7.2
- iOS and iPadOS 18.1.1

##

CVE-2024-42327
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T12:15:20.640000

5 posts

A non-admin user account on the Zabbix frontend with the default User role, or with any other role that gives API access can exploit this vulnerability. An SQLi exists in the CUser class in the addRelatedObjects function, this function is being called from the CUser.get function which is available for every user who has API access.

2 repos

https://github.com/aramosf/cve-2024-42327

https://github.com/zetraxz/CVE-2024-42327

decio at 2024-12-02T14:28:49.464Z ##

⚠️ Si vous utilisez la solution de monitoring Zabbix : Mise à jour urgente nécessaire.

Une vulnérabilité critique (CVE-2024-42327) a été détectée dans Zabbix, un outil de surveillance réseau et applicatif open-source.
Cette faille SQL Injection (9.9/10 CVSSv3) peut permettre une compromission totale du système.

👤 Les utilisateurs ayant un accès API, même non-admins, peuvent exploiter cette faille via la fonction CUser.get.

🎯 Versions affectées :

6.0.0 à 6.0.31
6.4.0 à 6.4.16
7.0.0

SQLi est une faille vieille de plusieurs décennies, simple à exploiter et fréquemment associée à des attaques comme les ransomwares ou les vols de données massifs (exemple MOVEit : 96M de personnes impactées).
⬇️

SQL injection in user.get API (CVE-2024-42327)
👇
https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBX-25623

[dans les news infosec]
⬇️
"Zabbix urges upgrades after critical SQL injection bug disclosure"
"US agencies blasted 'unforgivable' SQLi flaws earlier this year"
👇
https://www.theregister.com/2024/11/29/zabbix_urges_upgrades_after_critical/

#CyberVeille #Zabbix #CVE_2024_42327

CVE-2024-36467
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T09:40:28

4 posts

An authenticated user with API access (e.g.: user with default User role), more specifically a user with access to the user.update API endpoint is enough to be able to add themselves to any group (e.g.: Zabbix Administrators), except to groups that are disabled or having restricted GUI access.

##

CVE-2024-10175
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T09:40:28

4 posts

The Pricing Tables For WPBakery Page Builder (formerly Visual Composer) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's wdo_pricing_tables shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 1.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and

CVE-2024-5921(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T06:30:45

14 posts

An insufficient certification validation issue in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app enables attackers to connect the GlobalProtect app to arbitrary servers. This can enable a local non-administrative operating system user or an attacker on the same subnet to install malicious root certificates on the endpoint and subsequently install malicious software signed by the malicious root certifica

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T18:25:31.906Z ##

@Xavier yes, vulnerability details were publicly disclosed by AmberWolf at SANS HackFest Hollywood on 28 October 2024 before the patch and security advisory were made yesterday:

  • https://www.sans.org/blog/a-visual-summary-of-sans-hackfest-summit-2024/
  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/palo-alto-globalprotect---code-execution-and-privilege-escalation-via-malicious-vpn-server-cve-2024-5921/
  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/introducing-nachovpn---one-vpn-server-to-pwn-them-all/
##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T18:00:11.808Z ##

AmberWolf: Palo Alto GlobalProtect - RCE and Privilege Escalation via Malicious VPN Server (CVE-2024-5921)
Apparently AmberWolf was the source of "a publicly available conference talk discussing this issue" that Palo Alto Networks was aware of. AmberWolf presented vulnerability details at SANS HackFest Hollywood on 28 October 2024. Based on a review of their vulnerability disclosure timeline, Palo Alto Networks dilly-dallied for four months past the deadline when they should have locked in (before 14 July 2024). Of course AmberWolf is going to share the vulnerability details, but here is a blog version with the technical analysis of CVE-2024-5921. cc: @cR0w since both the blog posts about Palo Alto Networks and SonicWall are related. also @hrbrmstr

See related blog post Introducing NachoVPN: One VPN Server to Pwn Them All.

#proofofconcept #CVE_2024_5921 #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #zeroday #globalprotect #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.872Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_29014 #info #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T16:35:03.000Z ##

Researchers reveal exploitable flaws in corporate VPN clients https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/vulnerabilities-corporate-vpn-clients-cve-2024-5921-cve-2024-29014/ #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #AmberWolf #SonicWall #Hotstuff #Windows #macOS #News #CVE #VPN

hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-11-26T08:52:02.000Z ##

CVESky — https://cvesky.labs.greynoise.io/ — surfaced CVE-2024-5921 (another Palo priv. escal.) & showed Bluesky folks shared solid info on it ahead of metadata getting into major CVE platforms (likely due to NVD still being on life support). Scroll down in the free Feedly link for more stores,
1/2

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T04:36:36.638Z ##

Palo Alto Networks publicly disclosed vulnerability (zero-day): CVE-2024-5921 GlobalProtect App: Insufficient Certificate Validation Leads to Privilege Escalation
CVE-2024-5921 (CVSSv4: 5.6 medium) An insufficient certification validation issue in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app enables attackers to connect the GlobalProtect app to arbitrary servers. This can enable an attacker to install malicious root certificates on the endpoint and subsequently install malicious software signed by the malicious root certificates on that endpoint.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue. We are aware of a publicly available conference talk discussing this issue.

#CVE_2024_5921 #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #zeroday #globalprotect #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/palo-alto-globalprotect---code-execution-and-privilege-escalation-via-malicious-vpn-server-cve-2024-5921/
  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/introducing-nachovpn---one-vpn-server-to-pwn-them-all/

CVE-2024-49052
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T21:32:31

2 posts

Missing authentication for critical function in Microsoft Azure PolicyWatch allows an unauthorized attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T20:17:26.030Z ##

Microsoft: "we had one #PatchTuesday yes, but what about second Patch Tuesday?"

  • CVE-2024-49053 (7.6 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITATION DETECTED 🚩)
  • CVE-2024-49038 (9.3 critical) Microsoft Copilot Studio Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49052 (8.2 high) Microsoft Azure PolicyWatch Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Only CVE-2024-49053 has any substantial information in their FAQ section. CVE-2024-49035 is "not exploited" but "exploitation detected" 🤔 (analyst comment: likely a gaffe). The rest are Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #copilot #dynamics365 #azure

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T20:17:26.000Z ##

Microsoft: "we had one #PatchTuesday yes, but what about second Patch Tuesday?"

  • CVE-2024-49053 (7.6 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITATION DETECTED 🚩)
  • CVE-2024-49038 (9.3 critical) Microsoft Copilot Studio Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49052 (8.2 high) Microsoft Azure PolicyWatch Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Only CVE-2024-49053 has any substantial information in their FAQ section. CVE-2024-49035 is "not exploited" but "exploitation detected" 🤔 (analyst comment: likely a gaffe). The rest are Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #copilot #dynamics365 #azure

##

CVE-2024-9680
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.31%

updated 2024-11-26T21:32:23

13 posts

An attacker was able to achieve code execution in the content process by exploiting a use-after-free in Animation timelines. We have had reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 131.0.2, Firefox ESR < 128.3.1, and Firefox ESR < 115.16.1.

1 repos

https://github.com/tdonaworth/Firefox-CVE-2024-9680

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-27T11:40:01.000Z ##

##
threatcodex at 2024-11-26T19:15:41.057Z ##

RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
#RomComGroup #CVE_2023_36884 #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039
https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.164Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#romcom #russia #cyberespionage #firefox #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #microsoft #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039 #taskscheduler #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.000Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#romcom #russia #cyberespionage #firefox #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #microsoft #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039 #taskscheduler #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc

##
st1nger at 2024-11-27T17:02:56.336Z ##

#ESET Research details the analysis of a previously unknown vulnerability in #Mozilla products exploited in the wild. This critical vulnerability, assigned CVE-2024-9680 with a CVSS score of 9.8, allows vulnerable versions of #Firefox, #Thunderbird, and the #Tor Browser to execute code in the restricted context of the browser https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T11:10:04.000Z ##

RomCom hackers chained Firefox and Windows zero-days to deliver backdoor https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/ #RussianFederation #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #backdoor #exploit #Firefox #Windows #0-day #News #ESET #APT

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-11-26T10:20:58.612Z ##

Russia-aligned APT group RomCom was behind attacks that leveraged two zero-days earlier this year: CVE-2024-9680, a remote code execution flaw in Firefox, and CVE-2024-49039, an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Task Scheduler.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/

@ESETresearch #ZeroDay #Cybersecurity #APT

##

CVE-2024-49035
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T20:15:31.763000

10 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in Partner.Microsoft.com allows an a unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:33:40.572Z ##

Microsoft updated CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability to an EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY! 🥳😂👌 Happy Thanksgiving 🦃

Microsoft messed up again and had to correct their advisory. They had an "Exploitation Detected" flag but not an "Exploited" flag when this CVE was first announced.

@ekovacs reads my toots 👀. See Security Week article Microsoft Patches Exploited Vulnerability in Partner Network Website

#microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #copilot #dynamics365 #azure #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_49035

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-28T16:33:40.000Z ##

Microsoft updated CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability to an EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY! 🥳😂👌 Happy Thanksgiving 🦃

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-01T14:46:43.332Z ##

@zackwhittaker

  • did you already mention the Microsoft zero-day CVE-2024-49035? I think everyone missed that this week https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-49035
  • what timeframe is your week in security? RomCom exploited two different zero-days earlier this year and the details were published Tuesday: https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/
  • do you have a focus on vulnerabilities? a lot of software vendors published security advisories on Tuesday/Wednesday: Zyxel, Microsoft, Jenkins, Splunk, GitLab, Mozilla, VMware, Palo Alto Networks
  • Speaking of Palo Alto, https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/introducing-nachovpn---one-vpn-server-to-pwn-them-all/
  • EUROPOL arrests involving SKY ECC https://www.europol.europa.eu/media-press/newsroom/news/violent-albanian-criminal-group-linked-to-corruption-disrupted-sky-ecc-analysis and https://www.cbc.ca/newsinteractives/features/the-crime-messenger
##
jbhall56 at 2024-11-29T15:15:52.451Z ##

The vulnerability that has been tagged with an "Exploitation Detected" assessment is CVE-2024-49035 (CVSS score: 8.7), a privilege escalation flaw in partner[.]microsoft[.]com. https://thehackernews.com/2024/11/microsoft-fixes-ai-cloud-and-erp.html

##

CVE-2024-8237
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:32.033000

2 posts

A Denial of Service (DoS) issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions prior to 12.6 prior to 17.4.5, 17.5 prior to 17.5.3, and 17.6 prior to 17.6.1. An attacker could cause a denial of service with a crafted cargo.toml file.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-8114
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:31.660000

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 8.12 before 17.4.5, 17.5 before 17.5.3, and 17.6 before 17.6.1. This issue allows an attacker with access to a victim's Personal Access Token (PAT) to escalate privileges.

1 repos

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

##

CVE-2024-11668
(4.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:22.027000

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.11 before 17.4.5, 17.5 before 17.5.3, and 17.6 before 17.6.1. Long-lived connections could potentially bypass authentication controls, allowing unauthorized access to streaming results.

updated 2024-11-26T15:15:31.957000

5 posts

VMware Aria Operations contains a local privilege escalation vulnerability.  A malicious actor with local administrative privileges can insert malicious commands into the properties file to escalate privileges to  a root user on the appliance running VMware Aria Operations.

##

CVE-2024-11680
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T12:41:43

13 posts

ProjectSend versions prior to r1720 are affected by an improper authentication vulnerability. Remote, unauthenticated attackers can exploit this flaw by sending crafted HTTP requests to options.php, enabling unauthorized modification of the application's configuration. Successful exploitation allows attackers to create accounts, upload webshells, and embed malicious JavaScript.

#ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680
https://vulncheck.com/blog/projectsend-exploited-itw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T16:37:29.210Z ##

VulnCheck: ProjectSend CVE-2024-11680 Exploited in the Wild
@vulncheck reports that Public-facing ProjectSend instances appear to have been exploited by attackers. CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Unauthenticated Configuration Modification was assigned a CVE ID just yesterday (by VulnCheck), but was reported by Synactiv and patched by ProjectSend back on 16 May 2023. No indicators shared.

cc: @todb

#projectsend #CVE_2024_11680 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

(7.8 HIGH)

updated 2024-11-26T12:15:18.413000

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:02:54.745Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0022: VMware Aria Operations updates address multiple vulnerabilities(CVE-2024-38830, CVE-2024-38831, CVE-2024-38832, CVE-2024-38833, CVE-2024-38834)

  • CVE-2024-38830 (7.8 high) Local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38831 (7.8 high) Local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38832 (7.1 high) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38833 (6.8 medium) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38834 (6.5 medium) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability

No mention of exploitation

updated 2024-11-26T06:15:08.057000

6 posts

The Spam protection, Anti-Spam, FireWall by CleanTalk plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized Arbitrary Plugin Installation due to an missing empty value check on the 'api_key' value in the 'perform' function in all versions up to, and including, 6.44. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install and activate arbitrary plugins which can be leveraged to achieve remote

updated 2024-11-25T20:18:35

1 posts

Directory Traversal vulnerability in DotNetZip v.1.16.0 and before allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the src/Zip.Shared/ZipEntry.Extract.cs component.

swapgs@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T10:43:27.000Z ##

Finally got to publish the CVE for a "forever-day" path traversal in the .NET library DotNetZip affecting all releases since 2018. Enjoy, the PoC is in the patch! :blobcatsuit: #CVE_2024_48510

##

CVE-2024-10979
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-25T06:34:57

2 posts

Incorrect control of environment variables in PostgreSQL PL/Perl allows an unprivileged database user to change sensitive process environment variables (e.g. PATH). That often suffices to enable arbitrary code execution, even if the attacker lacks a database server operating system user. Versions before PostgreSQL 17.1, 16.5, 15.9, 14.14, 13.17, and 12.21 are affected.

ringzer0 at 2024-11-21T01:00:01.447Z ##

CVE-2024-53054
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-22T21:33:17

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: cgroup/bpf: use a dedicated workqueue for cgroup bpf destruction A hung_task problem shown below was found: INFO: task kworker/0:0:8 blocked for more than 327 seconds. "echo 0 > /proc/sys/kernel/hung_task_timeout_secs" disables this message. Workqueue: events cgroup_bpf_release Call Trace: <TASK> __schedule+0x5a2/0x2050 ? fi

1 repos

#search_error

adulau at 2024-11-29T09:21:26.019Z ##

Ever wondered what happens to rejected CVEs that still appear in other sources? Tools like vulnerability-lookup highlight these cases, underscoring the critical need to cross-correlate vulnerability data for accuracy and completeness.

cve-2024-53054 is a vulnerability in the Linux kernel documented but rejected as CVE.

#vulnerability #cve #cybersecurity #opensource #opendata #linuxkernel

🔗 https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/cve-2024-53054

CVE-2024-11477
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-22T21:32:24

12 posts

7-Zip Zstandard Decompression Integer Underflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of 7-Zip. Interaction with this library is required to exploit this vulnerability but attack vectors may vary depending on the implementation. The specific flaw exists within the implementation of Zstandard decompressio

1 repos

https://github.com/TheN00bBuilder/cve-2024-11477-writeup

ManzanasEnfrentadas@mas.to at 2024-11-28T11:02:22.000Z ##

🚨 🚨 🚨Actualización Importante:

Grave vulnerabilidad en 7-Zip (CVE-2024-11477): permite ejecución de código malicioso mediante archivos diseñados.

⚠️ Puntuación CVSS: 7.8.

🔒 Actualiza YA a la versión 24.07 o superior para proteger tu sistema.

##
appinn@pullopen.xyz at 2024-11-28T10:17:03.000Z ##

『7-Zip 爆高危漏洞，可远程执行代码，尽快更新至 24.08 版本』
著名的开源压缩/解压缩工具 7-ZIP 爆出一个高危漏洞 CVE-2024-11477，存在于 7-Zip 的 Zstandard 解压缩功能中，它允许攻击者在用户打开恶意压缩包时执行远程代码。该漏洞
……
阅读全文： :sys_link: https://www.appinn.com/7-zip-cve-2024-11477/

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-11477

boost to update your 7-zip

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-11-25T21:03:43.000Z ##

A severe security vulnerability has been discovered in 7-Zip, the popular file compression utility, allowing remote attackers to execute malicious code through specially crafted archives.

The vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-11477 has received a high CVSS score of 7.8, indicating significant security risks for users of affected versions.

this is bad ...

#security #7zip

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T14:05:27.404Z ##

@hrbrmstr CVE-2024-11477 (7.8 high, disclosed 20 November 2024 by Zero Day Initiative) improper input validation results in integer underflow, which can result in remote code execution in 7-Zip. It is fixed in 7-Zip 24.07 (6/19 was 5 months ago) but their changelog doesn't identify the security vulnerability or its severity.

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-11-25T14:02:55.000Z ##

CVESky (https://cvesky.labs.greynoise.io/) snagged CVE-2024-11477 today.

On the surface (I did no rev.eng.) this seems like it's gonna take alot of orgs (that allow ZIP uploads and then expands them) by surprise if it ends up being easily or even moderately exploitable. Check your SBOMs!

##
decio at 2024-11-25T09:37:44.019Z ##

⚠️ Vulnérabilité dans 7-Zip : mise à jour nécessaire
⬇️
Une faille permet aux attaquants d’injecter du code malveillant via des archives manipulées (CVE-2024-11477, risque élevé). Téléchargez et installez la version 24.08 sur le site officiel pour vous protéger.
👇
https://www.7-zip.org/

ℹ️ Pas de mise à jour automatique : action manuelle requise

"7-Zip flaw enables code smuggling with manipulated archives
Attackers can use manipulated archives to try to inject malicious code into 7-Zip users. An update is available."
👇
https://www.heise.de/en/news/7-Zip-flaw-enables-code-smuggling-with-manipulated-archives-10083922.html

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_11477 #7zip #vulnerabilite

##

CVE-2024-49054
(4.3 MEDIUM)

  • CVE-2024-11395 Type Confusion in V8 (mentioned Tuesday by Google)
  • CVE-2024-49054 (new, 4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability. FAQ section contains some humor. Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-22T16:15:34.680000

2 posts

Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access in Citrix Session Recording when an attacker is an authenticated user in the same Windows Active Directory domain as the session recording server domain

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T17:54:57.881Z ##

Be on the lookout: Exploitation reports for both Citrix Session Recording vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-8068 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium) Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access
  • CVE-2024-8069 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium/CISA-ADP: CVSSv3: 8.8 high) Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

#threatintel #citrix #virtualappsanddesktops #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_8068 #CVE_2024_8069 #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

An issue in the handling of URL protocols was addressed with improved logic. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.6, visionOS 1.3, Safari 17.6, watchOS 10.6, iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6, macOS Sonoma 14.6. A user may be able to bypass some web content restrictions.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T20:23:05.151Z ##

Cisco updated a security advisory from 2014: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

#cisco #CiscoASA #CVE_2024_2120 #cybersecurity #infosec #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation

##

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

CVE-2024-23832
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-11-21T08:58:31.150000

2 posts

Mastodon is a free, open-source social network server based on ActivityPub Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior

1 repos

#search_error

avuko at 2024-11-27T15:20:41.165Z ##

Just a gentle periodic reminder that #TruthSocial is by any way I can legally determine, still running the 3.4.1 version of Mastodon.

3.4.1 was released on 2021-06-03 (https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v3.4.1) which means it very likely includes the #CVE202423832 vuln, as well as many others.

The 3.4.10 release (9 updates later!) had its End Of Life 2 years ago (2022-11-06), so 3.4.1 is shockingly ancient.

It is an accident which has likely already happened.

##
avuko@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-27T15:20:41.000Z ##

3.4.1 was released on 2021-06-03 (https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/tag/v3.4.1) which means it very likely includes the #CVE202423832 vuln, as well as many others.

The 3.4.10 release (9 updates later!) had its End Of Life 2 years ago (2022-11-06), so 3.4.1 is shockingly ancient.

It is an accident which has likely already happened.

CVE-2024-1947
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T08:51:39.637000

2 posts

A denial of service (DoS) condition was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 13.2.4 before 16.10.6, 16.11 before 16.11.3, and 17.0 before 17.0.1. By leveraging this vulnerability an attacker could create a DoS condition by sending crafted API calls.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

CVE-2023-40238

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T08:19:02.947000

2 posts

A LogoFAIL issue was discovered in BmpDecoderDxe in Insyde InsydeH2O with kernel 5.2 before 05.28.47, 5.3 before 05.37.47, 5.4 before 05.45.47, 5.5 before 05.53.47, and 5.6 before 05.60.47 for certain Lenovo devices. Image parsing of crafted BMP logo files can copy data to a specific address during the DXE phase of UEFI execution. This occurs because of an integer signedness error involving PixelH

CVE-2023-30545
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-11-21T08:00:23.783000

2 posts

PrestaShop is an Open Source e-commerce web application. Prior to versions 8.0.4 and 1.7.8.9, it is possible for a user with access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrarily read any file on the operating system when using SQL function `LOAD_FILE` in a `SELECT` request. This gives the user access to critical information. A patch is available in PrestaShop 8.0.4 and PS 1.7.8.

1 repos

https://github.com/drkbcn/lblfixer_cve_2023_30839

faker at 2024-11-25T17:11:14.346Z ##

I really wish there were more CVSS example ratings.
In the "Common Vulnerability Classes" section of the examples there is a "SQL injection" issue[1]. Great!
Maybe you'd be as surprised as me to see it rated under CVSS3.1 with only 6.5/medium?
That's because it's "kind of"-SQL injection. Here is the description:

> [...] it is possible for a user with access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrarily read any file on the operating system when using SQL function `LOAD_FILE` in a `SELECT` request. [...]

Is that REALLY the most common SQLi scenario? Come on!

[1] https://www.first.org/cvss/v4.0/examples#SQL-Injection-CVE-2023-30545

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T17:11:14.000Z ##

I really wish there were more CVSS example ratings.
In the "Common Vulnerability Classes" section of the examples there is a "SQL injection" issue[1]. Great!
Maybe you'd be as surprised as me to see it rated under CVSS3.1 with only 6.5/medium?
That's because it's "kind of"-SQL injection. Here is the description:

> [...] it is possible for a user with access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrarily read any file on the operating system when using SQL function `LOAD_FILE` in a `SELECT` request. [...]

Is that REALLY the most common SQLi scenario? Come on!

[1] https://www.first.org/cvss/v4.0/examples#SQL-Injection-CVE-2023-30545

CVE-2023-27532
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.29%

updated 2024-11-21T07:53:06.657000

2 posts

Vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication component allows encrypted credentials stored in the configuration database to be obtained. This may lead to gaining access to the backup infrastructure hosts.

3 repos

https://github.com/puckiestyle/CVE-2023-27532-RCE-Only

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-27532

https://github.com/sfewer-r7/CVE-2023-27532

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:02:37.330Z ##

The DFIR Report: The Curious Case of an Egg-Cellent Resume
The DFIR Report provides a case study of an ongoing more_eggs malware campaign run by the financially motivated TA4557/FIN6 cybercrime group. This was investigated in March 2024, with the initial access being resume lure (TA4557 modus operandi). CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Veeam Backup missing authentication vulnerability is leveraged. The DFIR Report notes that several leaked hostnames are linked to Fog ransomware attacks as reported by Arctic Wolf. Indicators of compromise, sigma and Yara rules provided.

#ta4557 #FIN6 #more_eggs #CVE_2023_27532 #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #cybercrime #IOC #yara #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:02:37.000Z ##

The DFIR Report: The Curious Case of an Egg-Cellent Resume
The DFIR Report provides a case study of an ongoing more_eggs malware campaign run by the financially motivated TA4557/FIN6 cybercrime group. This was investigated in March 2024, with the initial access being resume lure (TA4557 modus operandi). CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Veeam Backup missing authentication vulnerability is leveraged. The DFIR Report notes that several leaked hostnames are linked to Fog ransomware attacks as reported by Arctic Wolf. Indicators of compromise, sigma and Yara rules provided.

An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to
