AAKL at 2024-11-26T16:04:40.605Z ##

Kaspersky: Analysis of Elpaco: a Mimic variant, exploiting CVE-2020-1472 https://securelist.com/elpaco-ransomware-a-mimic-variant/114635/ @Kaspersky #cybersecurity #infosec #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:18:36.280Z ##

Kaspersky: Analysis of Elpaco: a Mimic variant
Kaspersky provides a malware analysis of a Mimic ransomware variant named Elpaco. The attackers would brute force attack the victim's server via RDP, and leverage the ZeroLogon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (vendor 5.5/NVD 10.0 critical) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability before deploying ransomware. It appears to be a Windows based ransomware. Kaspersky provides indicators of compromise, Yara rules, and TTPS mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

#elpaco #mimicransomware #ransomware #malwareanalysis #cve_2020_1472 #zerologon #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #yara #mitreattack #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##

##

Kaspersky: Analysis of Elpaco: a Mimic variant
Kaspersky provides a malware analysis of a Mimic ransomware variant named Elpaco. The attackers would brute force attack the victim's server via RDP, and leverage the ZeroLogon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (vendor 5.5/NVD 10.0 critical) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability before deploying ransomware. It appears to be a Windows based ransomware. Kaspersky provides indicators of compromise, Yara rules, and TTPS mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

CVE-2017-17215
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 62.32%

updated 2024-11-21T03:17:40.740000

2 posts

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

4 repos

https://github.com/ltfafei/HuaWei_Route_HG532_RCE_CVE-2017-17215

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.322Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

#matrix #ddos #ddosaas #scriptkiddie #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc #vulnerability #eitw #iot #botnet #activeexploitation #mirai

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2024-11-21T03:08:40.607000

2 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.983Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.000Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

CVE-2014-2120
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-11-21T02:05:41.473000

2 posts

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the WebVPN login page in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an unspecified parameter, aka Bug ID CSCun19025.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T20:23:05.151Z ##

Cisco updated a security advisory from 2014: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

#cisco #CiscoASA #CVE_2024_2120 #cybersecurity #infosec #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation

CVE-2024-10924
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-11-20T15:30:50

1 posts

The Really Simple Security (Free, Pro, and Pro Multisite) plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to authentication bypass in versions 9.0.0 to 9.1.1.1. This is due to improper user check error handling in the two-factor REST API actions with the 'check_login_and_get_user' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to log in as any existing user on the site, such as an administrat

CVE-2024-11395

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-19T20:07:58.374Z ##

Oracle exploited zero-day: Security Alert CVE-2024-21287 Released

  • CVE-2024-21287 (7.5 high) Vulnerability in the Oracle Agile PLM Framework product of Oracle Supply Chain (component: Software Development Kit, Process Extension). The supported version that is affected is 9.3.6. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Agile PLM Framework. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle Agile PLM Framework accessible data.

It was reported as being actively exploited "in the wild" by CrowdStrike.

Oracle's actual security advisory Oracle Security Alert Advisory - CVE-2024-21287 is useless because it doesn't mention exploitation.

h/t: @lawrenceabrams See Bleeping Computer reporting: Oracle warns of Agile PLM file disclosure flaw exploited in attacks
cc: @campuscodi @mttaggart @cR0w @ntkramer @iagox86 @dreadpir8robots @catc0n @harrysintonen @neurovagrant etc.

#oracle #agile #oracleagileplm #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cve #CVE_2024_21287

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-19T20:07:58.000Z ##

Oracle exploited zero-day: Security Alert CVE-2024-21287 Released

  • CVE-2024-21287 (7.5 high) Vulnerability in the Oracle Agile PLM Framework product of Oracle Supply Chain (component: Software Development Kit, Process Extension). The supported version that is affected is 9.3.6. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle Agile PLM Framework. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle Agile PLM Framework accessible data.

It was reported as being actively exploited "in the wild" by CrowdStrike.

Oracle's actual security advisory Oracle Security Alert Advisory - CVE-2024-21287 is useless because it doesn't mention exploitation.

CVE-2024-2550(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-14T12:31:01

9 posts

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the GlobalProtect gateway in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker to stop the GlobalProtect service on the firewall by sending a specially crafted packet that causes a denial of service (DoS) condition. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition result in the firewall entering maintenance mode.

##

CVE-2024-8069
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-13T18:31:59

4 posts

Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access in Citrix Session Recording if the attacker is an authenticated user on the same intranet as the session recording server

1 repos

https://github.com/XiaomingX/cve-2024-8069-exp-Citrix-Virtual-Apps-XEN

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T17:54:57.881Z ##

Be on the lookout: Exploitation reports for both Citrix Session Recording vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-8068 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium) Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access
  • CVE-2024-8069 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium/CISA-ADP: CVSSv3: 8.8 high) Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

#threatintel #citrix #virtualappsanddesktops #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_8068 #CVE_2024_8069 #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
threatcodex at 2024-11-26T19:15:41.057Z ##

RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
#RomComGroup #CVE_2023_36884 #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039
https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.164Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#romcom #russia #cyberespionage #firefox #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #microsoft #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039 #taskscheduler #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.000Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Russia-aligned APT group RomCom was behind attacks that leveraged two zero-days earlier this year: CVE-2024-9680, a remote code execution flaw in Firefox, and CVE-2024-49039, an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Task Scheduler.

CVE-2024-47685
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-11-08T18:30:44

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: netfilter: nf_reject_ipv6: fix nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put() syzbot reported that nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put() was possibly sending garbage on the four reserved tcp bits (th->res1) Use skb_put_zero() to clear the whole TCP header, as done in nf_reject_ip_tcphdr_put() BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value in nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put+0x688/0x6c0

I DARE anyone to justify the continued existence of the Linux CNA

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2024-10-17T15:31:09

1 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via T3, IIOP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Oracle WebLogic Server. CVS

##

CVE-2024-38812
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.42%

updated 2024-10-02T15:30:37

6 posts

The vCenter Server contains a heap-overflow vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/groshi/CVE-2024-38812-POC-5-Hands-Private

patchnow24x7 at 2024-11-21T03:17:10.322Z ##

Link: https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

A command injection vulnerability in the IPSec VPN feature of Zyxel ATP series firmware versions from V4.32 through V5.38, USG FLEX series firmware versions from V4.50 through V5.38, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions from V4.16 through V5.38, and USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions from V4.16 through V5.38 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute some OS commands on an affected d

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.637Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T03:45:39.305Z ##

Cyfirma: Investigation into Helldown : RANSOMWARE
Cyfirma provides a lightweight analysis of Helldown ransomware, both Windows and Linux. They also believe that CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability plays a role in initial access. Cyfirma includes a Sigma rule and hashes for the ransomware.

See the Sekoia article in the parent toot above for more details.

#ransomware #helldown #CVE_2024_42057 #zyxel #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Sigma

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-19T14:46:29.232Z ##

Sekoia: Helldown Ransomware: an overview of this emerging threat
Sekoia offers a threat actor profile for Helldown ransomware, a relatively new threat actor group performing double extortion (with a data leak site). A potential Zyxel vulnerability that Helldown exploits is CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability. They provide a technical analysis (dynamic and static) of both the Windows and Linux variants of Helldown ransomware. Indicators of compromise are listed.

#Helldown #ransomware #cybercrime #CVE_2024_42057 #zyxel #vulnerability #malwareanalysis #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence

##

English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CVE-2021-20123
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 49.45%

updated 2024-08-30T15:31:25

2 posts

A local file inclusion vulnerability exists in Draytek VigorConnect 1.6.0-B3 in the file download functionality of the DownloadFileServlet endpoint. An unauthenticated attacker could leverage this vulnerability to download arbitrary files from the underlying operating system with root privileges.

Nuclei template

TomSellers at 2024-11-22T14:41:51.672Z ##

Hey folks, if you post bare links with no commentary or description of what you are linking to then you are probably not having the impact you think you are. Many folks, such as myself, will not open these. The exception would be those sites that show expanded cards in Mastodon.

Also, links to youtu.be don't expand and don't display a card so we have no idea what you are linking. I ain't opening that either. Links to youtube.com do provide cards and context.

For Security folks, talking about CVE numbers, particularly those that aren't on fire right now, without any context about the product or vuln makes your reader do work just to understand if they should care about what you are saying. If the reader is on a mobile device this can be frustrating.

For example:

FYI, CVE-2021-20123 doesn't require auth and can provide access to creds

WTF am I supposed to do with that? Why are we talking about a 3 year old vuln? Should I care? Great, now I have homework..

FYI, CVE-2021-20123 (an LFI in Draytek VigorConnect) doesn't require auth and can provide access to creds

I immediately know if I should care or not.

Obvs, you do you but know that you can have a greater impact by providing context.

#Security

##
TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-22T14:41:51.000Z ##

Hey folks, if you post bare links with no commentary or description of what you are linking to then you are probably not having the impact you think you are. Many folks, such as myself, will not open these. The exception would be those sites that show expanded cards in Mastodon.

Also, links to youtu.be don't expand and don't display a card so we have no idea what you are linking. I ain't opening that either. Links to youtube.com do provide cards and context.

For Security folks, talking about CVE numbers, particularly those that aren't on fire right now, without any context about the product or vuln makes your reader do work just to understand if they should care about what you are saying. If the reader is on a mobile device this can be frustrating.

For example:

FYI, CVE-2021-20123 doesn't require auth and can provide access to creds

WTF am I supposed to do with that? Why are we talking about a 3 year old vuln? Should I care? Great, now I have homework..

FYI, CVE-2021-20123 (an LFI in Draytek VigorConnect) doesn't require auth and can provide access to creds

I immediately know if I should care or not.

Obvs, you do you but know that you can have a greater impact by providing context.

#Security

##

CVE-2024-45237
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-27T15:48:34.030000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Fort before 1.6.3. A malicious RPKI repository that descends from a (trusted) Trust Anchor can serve (via rsync or RRDP) a resource certificate containing a Key Usage extension composed of more than two bytes of data. Fort writes this string into a 2-byte buffer without properly sanitizing its length, leading to a buffer overflow.

arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-11-26T06:53:44.000Z ##

Poster: From Fort to Foe: The Threat of RCE in RPKI

Oliver Jacobsen, Haya Schulmann, Niklas Vogel, Michael Waidner
https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/html/2411.16518

arXiv:2411.16518v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: In this work, we present a novel severe buffer-overflow vulnerability in the RPKI validator Fort, that allows an attacker to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the machine running the software. We discuss the unique impact of this RCE on networks that use RPKI, illustrating that RCE vulnerabilities are especially severe in the context of RPKI. The design of RPKI makes RCE easy to exploit on a large scale, allows compromise of RPKI validation integrity, and enables a powerful vector for additional attacks on other critical components of the network, like the border routers.
We analyze the vulnerability exposing to this RCE and identify indications that the discovered vulnerability could constitute an intentional backdoor to compromise systems running the software over a benign coding mistake. We disclosed the vulnerability, which has been assigned a CVE rated 9.8 critical (CVE-2024-45237).

##
arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-11-26T06:53:44.000Z ##

Poster: From Fort to Foe: The Threat of RCE in RPKI

Oliver Jacobsen, Haya Schulmann, Niklas Vogel, Michael Waidner
https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/html/2411.16518

arXiv:2411.16518v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: In this work, we present a novel severe buffer-overflow vulnerability in the RPKI validator Fort, that allows an attacker to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the machine running the software. We discuss the unique impact of this RCE on networks that use RPKI, illustrating that RCE vulnerabilities are especially severe in the context of RPKI. The design of RPKI makes RCE easy to exploit on a large scale, allows compromise of RPKI validation integrity, and enables a powerful vector for additional attacks on other critical components of the network, like the border routers.
We analyze the vulnerability exposing to this RCE and identify indications that the discovered vulnerability could constitute an intentional backdoor to compromise systems running the software over a benign coding mistake. We disclosed the vulnerability, which has been assigned a CVE rated 9.8 critical (CVE-2024-45237).

updated 2024-08-26T21:30:31

2 posts

In startInstall of UpdateFetcher.java, there is a possible way to trigger a malicious config update due to a logic error. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T18:29:50.993Z ##

How likely would a Beijing-based cybersecurity company comply with the requirement to first report software vulnerabilities to the PRC Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT)? 🤔 After 4 months, Microsoft credited bee13oy with Cyber Kunlun Lab for CVE-2024-38199, (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This was marked publicly disclosed at the time of announcement.

Not disparaging their company, just curious as to the background of CVE-2024-38199 being publicly disclosed.

updated 2024-08-14T15:31:10

1 posts

RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to ac

habr@zhub.link at 2024-11-28T07:42:15.000Z ##

Пентест для самых маленьких на примере WinRAR

Атаки с использованием уже давно пропатченной уязвимости WinRAR остаются актуальными для многих компаний. Разберемся как устроена типовая атака, как злоумышленники обходят антивирусы, что делать для защиты. И, конечно, попробуем самостоятельно провести типовую атаку.

https://habr.com/ru/companies/alfa/articles/861298/

##

CVE-2024-2054
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.45%

updated 2024-08-05T21:32:26

2 posts

The Artica-Proxy administrative web application will deserialize arbitrary PHP objects supplied by unauthenticated users and subsequently enable code execution as the "www-data" user.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-11-24T19:19:06.822Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @todb @h4sh

One more example that I was able to find: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/112130101612487106 a vulnerability reporter reached out to the vendor who didn't respond, and after having issues communicating with MITRE, KoreLogic reached out to Austin Hackers Anonymous @AustinHackers to get a CVE assigned (CVE-2024-2054) for an unpatched Artica Proxy Unauthenticated PHP Deserialization Vulnerability.

EDIT: Timeline from contacting vendor to CVE assigned was 74 days, 78 includes public disclosure.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-24T19:19:06.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @todb @h4sh

One more example that I was able to find: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/112130101612487106 a vulnerability reporter reached out to the vendor who didn't respond, and after having issues communicating with MITRE, KoreLogic reached out to Austin Hackers Anonymous @AustinHackers to get a CVE assigned (CVE-2024-2054) for an unpatched Artica Proxy Unauthenticated PHP Deserialization Vulnerability.

EDIT: Timeline from contacting vendor to CVE assigned was 74 days, 78 includes public disclosure.

##

CVE-2024-29014
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:12

5 posts

Vulnerability in SonicWall NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T19:10:43.669Z ##

@cR0w @hrbrmstr Judging by the SonicWall NetExtender vulnerability analysis, there are three vectors of achieving RCE:

  • An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. (UserInteraction:Required) They would then send a fake EPC Client update (malicious executable) signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This is the vulnerability.
  • "When the SMA Connect Agent is installed, attackers can exploit a custom URI handler to force the NetExtender client to connect to their server. Users only need to visit a malicious website and accept a browser prompt, or open a malicious document for the attack to succeed." (UI:R)
  • A low-privileged user on the same machine can exploit this vulnerability to escalate their privileges to SYSTEM by connecting to a malicious server. (LPE?)
##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.872Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_29014 #info #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T16:35:03.000Z ##

Researchers reveal exploitable flaws in corporate VPN clients https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/vulnerabilities-corporate-vpn-clients-cve-2024-5921-cve-2024-29014/ #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #AmberWolf #SonicWall #Hotstuff #Windows #macOS #News #CVE #VPN

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.000Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

CVE-2024-5034
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:03

1 posts

The SULly WordPress plugin before 4.3.1 does not have CSRF checks in some places, which could allow attackers to make logged in users perform unwanted actions via CSRF attacks

1 repos

https://github.com/Nyamort/CVE-2024-50340

alex@bouma.social at 2024-11-19T10:50:25.000Z ##

@valorin I found this one a pretty good summary: https://blog.nollium.com/cve-2024-50340-remote-access-to-symfony-profiler-via-injected-arguments-d2f14b4f6ad7 although I believe Laravel applications were only impacted for the application environment name (production/staging etc.) and the debug flag was Symfony specific.

##

CVE-2024-0519
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-07-27T00:32:45

2 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.038Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US

  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-06-12T12:30:40

2 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.48%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

##

CVE-2024-20359
(6.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2024-04-24T21:32:04

2 posts

A vulnerability in a legacy capability that allowed for the preloading of VPN clients and plug-ins and that has been available in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary code with root-level privileges. Administrator-level privileges are required to exploit this vulnerabilit

1 repos

https://github.com/west-wind/Threat-Hunting-With-Splunk

screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.038Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311

『7-Zip 爆高危漏洞，可远程执行代码，尽快更新至 24.08 版本』

……

CVE-2024-20767
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 13.14%

updated 2024-03-18T12:31:54

1 posts

ColdFusion versions 2023.6, 2021.12 and earlier are affected by an Improper Access Control vulnerability that could lead to arbitrary file system read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass security measures and gain unauthorized access to sensitive files and perform arbitrary file system write. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

Nuclei template

JeremiahFieldhaven@mastodon.gamedev.place at 2024-11-27T10:59:46.000Z ##

Looking at the release for a large piece of software this morning, I'm reminded that my brain doesn't work like some security people's.

It's not *quite* "CVE-2024-1234: if an attacker has obtained a user's username, password, date of birth, first pet's name, street they grew up on, and mother's maiden name, they can in rare circumstances perform this very difficult and dubiously physically-possible set of actions to edit their profile picture. This is a critical vulnerability!"

screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.038Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 5.17%

updated 2024-01-31T05:07:15

2 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.038Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.76%

updated 2024-01-22T18:31:16

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

Cowards.

"INC Ransom is known to use CitrixBleed (CVE-2023-4966), a critical software vulnerability found in 2023 in Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway appliances. This vulnerability allows threat actors to bypass multifactor authentication (MFA) and hijack legitimate user sessions."

CVE-2022-38028
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2023-02-03T05:02:37

2 posts

Windows Print Spooler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-22T12:13:30.397Z ##

Volexity: The Nearest Neighbor Attack: How A Russian APT Weaponized Nearby Wi-Fi Networks for Covert Access

  • Russian state-sponsored APT28 (publicly attributed to Russian GRU, tracked by Volexity as GruesomeLarch) deployed a new attack technique leveraging Wi-Fi networks in close proximity to the intended target.
  • The threat actor primarily leveraged living-off-the-land techniques.
  • A zero-day privilege escalation (CVE-2022-38028) was used to further gain access.
  • Ukrainian-related work and projects were targeted in this attack, just ahead of Russian Invasion of Ukraine.

#russia #GruesomeLarch #APT #cyberespionage #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-22T12:13:30.000Z ##

  • The threat actor primarily leveraged living-off-the-land techniques.
  • A zero-day privilege escalation (CVE-2022-38028) was used to further gain access.
  • Ukrainian-related work and projects were targeted in this attack, just ahead of Russian Invasion of Ukraine.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.322Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

#matrix #ddos #ddosaas #scriptkiddie #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc #vulnerability #eitw #iot #botnet #activeexploitation #mirai

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.000Z ##

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:06

Credentials for Zivif PR115-204-P-RS V2.3.4.2103 Webcams can be obtained by an unauthenticated remote attacker using a standard web /cgi-bin/hi3510/param.cgi?cmd=getuser HTTP request. This vulnerability exists because of a lack of authentication checks in requests to CGI pages.

CVE-2017-1182

updated 2023-02-02T05:00:49

4 posts

IBM Tivoli Monitoring Portal v6 could allow a local (network adjacent) attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, when default client-server default communications, HTTP, are being used. IBM X-Force ID: 123493.

2 repos

https://github.com/thatskriptkid/CVE-2017-11826

https://github.com/chefphenix25/vuln-rabilit-windows7

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.983Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

CVE-2020-0238(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-01-29T05:03:41

2 posts

In updatePreferenceIntents of AccountTypePreferenceLoader, there is a possible confused deputy attack due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege and launching privileged activities with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10 Android-8.0Android ID: A-15094663

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 52.48%

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:40

2 posts

In TP-Link Router AX50 firmware 210730 and older, import of a malicious backup file via web interface can lead to remote code execution due to improper validation.

3 repos

https://github.com/SAJIDAMINE/CVE-2022-30075

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.322Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

#matrix #ddos #ddosaas #scriptkiddie #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc #vulnerability #eitw #iot #botnet #activeexploitation #mirai

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

todb at 2024-12-01T14:59:24.379Z ##

@buherator That’s a nice bit of CVE lore! We should make these more obvious and prominent than a single blog post.

And yes, having a small set of always-valid-but-test CVEs would be nice to publish. That’s a neat idea.

Hey would it be cool to make them Luhn-formula-like so you can detect truncation?

Something like

CVE-2024-12342
CVE-2025-12343
CVE-2026-12340

(all the digits add up to modulo 0)

cc @zmanion

screaminggoat at 2024-11-22T01:34:44.447Z ##

Adobe security advisory: APSB24-91 | Security Update Available for Adobe InDesign
This was unexpected outside of Patch Tuesday. Adobe has an Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability CVE-2024-49529 (5.5 medium) that allows for memory leak. Credited to Mat Powell of @thezdi

Adobe is not aware of any exploits in the wild for any of the issues addressed in these updates.

#adobe #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_49529 #indesign

CVE-2024-10224
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/njeru-codes/needrestart-vulnerability-poc

ckure at 2024-11-20T21:09:34.638Z ##

It has been 0 days since I've had to tap the sign:
https://infosec.exchange/@ckure/111970971640286655

"CVE-2024-10224: local attackers can execute arbitrary shell commands as root by tricking needrestart into open()ing a filename of the form "commands|" (technically, this vulnerability is in Perl's ScanDeps module, but it is unclear whether this module was ever meant to operate on attacker-controlled files or not)."

https://www.qualys.com/2024/11/19/needrestart/needrestart.txt

##
ckure@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-20T21:09:34.000Z ##

It has been 0 days since I've had to tap the sign:
https://infosec.exchange/@ckure/111970971640286655

"CVE-2024-10224: local attackers can execute arbitrary shell commands as root by tricking needrestart into open()ing a filename of the form "commands|" (technically, this vulnerability is in Perl's ScanDeps module, but it is unclear whether this module was ever meant to operate on attacker-controlled files or not)."

https://www.qualys.com/2024/11/19/needrestart/needrestart.txt
